abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Development Project
            for Mongolia had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that a stable banking environment
            and improved regulatory framework would be some
            prerequisites for the success of the line of credit. The
            straightforward design of the lending operation was an
            important factor in the successful completion of the
            activity. It is important to have strong ownership of the
            project by the government and the central bank for the
            project's monitoring and coordinating activities. The
            focus on sub-loan portfolio quality and the overall
            financial position and performance of the Participating
            Financial Institutions (PFIs) is crucial to the achievement
            of the project's developmental objectives. A suitable
            time frame needs to be reflected in the preparation for the
            institutional-building and technical assistance components,
            especially in countries with weak civil service such as
            Mongolia. Appropriate amount of supervision and monitoring
            was the underlying achievement of the project. Criteria for
            the evaluation of a training program would need to be
            designed to facilitate the assessment of its results and
            contribution to the capacity building activities of the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Mongolia - Private Sector Development
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The paramount challenge for the country,
            within a strategic context is to raise the poverty line
            percentage, through the creation of a framework for private
            sector growth, hence poor households would be targeted more
            effectively. Within a broader assistance program, the
            Private Sector Development Credit will support the
            development of private enterprise and financial sectors, and
            will complement technical assistance for commercial banks,
            also provided by other international agencies. The project
            components provide for a line of credit to support the
            Borrower's efforts in the promotion of private sector
            development. Secondly, technical assistance to strengthen
            the institutional capacity of the banking system will be
            provided to the Bank of Mongolia (BOM), the Ministry of
            Finance (MOF), and the Counterpart Working Group (CWG).
            Participating financial intermediaries will also benefit
            through technical assistance for capacity building. Direct
            benefits will derive from the creation of a market for
            medium and long-term loans for private sector enterprises,
            which will allow the transfer of financial resources for
            sound economic initiatives.
